60  CHAPTER 3 RURAL SETTLEMENT AND URBAN SETTLEMENT 
Mind the Gap CAPS Grade 12 Geography
Chapter
3
Description
Photograph
Orthophoto
Heavy industry
• Found on the outskirts of the 
city where land is cheapest
• Found near major road and 
rail networks for transport of 
raw materials and finished 
products
• Often low-income housing is 
found nearby
• Heavy air and noise pollution
• Needs to be on flat land, 
near a water source
(vi)
Middle- to high-income 
residential/upper class 
residential
• Found away from the CBD
• Often has a good view
• Townhouses and big houses
• Larger properties as more 
space is available
• Good services and facilities, 
including recreation areas
(vii)
(viii)
Low-income 
residential/working 
class residential
• Buildings very close together
• Close to business area
• Fewer facilities and poor 
services
• Small blocks
• Buildings look the same
(ix)
Informal settlement
• Found on the city outskirts
• No service delivery (no 
roads, sanitation, water, 
electricity or schools)
• High poverty levels
• High crime rates
• Houses are built out of 
plastic, wood, zinc, etc
• Unhealthy conditions
• Very dense housing with 
unplanned street patterns
(x)
